On Wednesday, November 3rd 2004, (after the 2004 USA Presidential Elections) many Americans awoke rejoicing, others awoke in disbelief, wondering "what just happened?". The headlines read, "The People Have Spoken!"... but, is this really what the 'people' were saying?

Aerosol Warfare Gallery, through Red vs Blue, is providing an outlet for total freedom of (artistic) expression. Top Artists and Designers from across the United States and from around the world have voiced their opinion via 11"x17" poster art. The love/hate towards the 2004 elections, the process, the outcome, the media influence, and the future of the American Dream are just a few of the themes reflected in the exhibition.

The 'Red vs Blue' exhibition steps to promote dialog and unification in this divided nation. open the lines of communication between the Republicans and the Democrats, between the Independents and the Undecided, between the Left Wing Liberals and Right Wing Conservatives, Between the Haves and the Have-Nots, Between the Voices that are heard and the Voices Ignored.

This exhibition will open on Saturday, December 18th, 2004 in Houston, TX (ground zero to all that is Bush).

"It isn't enough to talk about Peace...One must Believe in it! It isn't enough to Believe in it...One must Work at it.!" Eleanor Roosevelt.

Participating Artists: Bubble Gum and Braces, Brett Webb, People on Purple, Merge360, Christian Azul, Ethos, AdFunture Workshop, CRAP Art, GONZO247, Mr Bristle, JESTER, DJ Battle Monkey, Monk, Color One, King157, Zoltron, Zulu237, Take7, Douglas Thompson x, Lucky Bunny, Prime, Joe B, Article3, Rafael 'Magik' Villarreal, Reverend Butter, Adam Janusz, Supher, Melinda Mosheim, Leslie Ferrer, ASO, CRUZ, Mad Pilot, Nine, David Chein, others to be announced

Overkill & Eiszeit Kino Abend:

Berlin-Filmpremiere: "Daily Operation"

Am Sonntag den 05.12.2004 um 17.00 Uhr, präsentieren Daily Operation in Zusammenarbeit mit Overkill Berlin, den Film "Daily Operation" im Eiszeit Kino (Saal 1) in Berlin Kreuzberg.

Der Film zeigt eine grosse Menge an fahrenden Live-Trains mit vielen geilen Burner-Pieces darauf. Gezeigt werden auch viele Live-Bombing Actions auf vielen verschiedenen Trains wie S-Bahnen, ICE's, Steeler'n und Dopppeldecker'n - in Yards, Lay-Up's und auch leckere Bahnhof Actions sind am Start!

Das Ganze spielt sich in folgenden Städten ab: Leipzig, Dresden, Berlin und Frankfurt am Main!

West Coast North America, 2004

Perpetual Motion Roadshow

Josh MacPhee, Stencil Pirates

Melissa Klein, Inkling Zine

Jennifer Whiteford, Matilda Zine

Schedule:

San Francisco: Mon Dec 6, 7pm: Modern Times Bookstore, 888 Valencia St.

Eugene: Tues Dec 7, 7pm: Feinstein's Museum of Unfine Art, 537 Willamette

Seattle: Wed Dec 8, 7pm: Confounded Books, 315 E. Pine St.

Victoria: Thurs Dec 9, 8pm: Solstice Cafe, 529 Pandora Ave.

Portland: Fri Dec 10, 7pm: Reading Frenzy, 921 SW Oak St.

LA: Sun Dec 12, 7pm: Flor y Canto, 3706 N. Figueroa Ave.

Santa Cruz: Tues Dec 14, tba (with Erick Lyle/Scam Zine)

Oakland: Wed Dec 15, 7pm: AK Press Warehouse, 674-A 23rd St. (with Erick Lyle/Scam Zine)

Josh MacPhee is an artist and activist based in Chicago whose work often revolves around themes of radical politics and public space. He recently released his first book, Stencil Pirates: A Global Survey of Street Stenciling (Soft Skull Press). When not destroying his lungs with spraypaint or getting sticky with wheatpaste, he organizes the Celebrate People's History Poster Series and works with larger groups of artists to create giant collective cultural events like the Department of Space and Land Reclamation and the Autonomous Territories of Chicago. Josh will share a slide show history of street stenciling and discussion of expression in public space.

Melissa Klein lives in San Francisco, where she writes and illustrates the fiction zine Inkling, performs short plays and monologues, and works with her punk community to create humorous political street theater. She recently co-edited, with Sara Jaffe, the audiozine Long Ago and Right Now, a compilation of songs and stories about San Francisco. Melissa's new book, Looking and Other Stories, is a collaboration with artist Sara Thustra. It includes work from her zines as well as stories that have appeared in Punk Planet, the anthology It's All Good (Manic D Press) and elsewhere. She will be reading from this book, with pictures projected for your multisensory enjoyment.

Jennifer Whiteford teaches, writes, and goes to rock shows in Ottawa, Ontario. Her six year old perzine, Matilda has won rave reviews and spawned her online journal Matilda Says. Last year, she released The Mattie Stories, a collection of short fiction one reviewer called "the Vinyl Cafe for indie rockers." Up until very recently, Jennifer played guitar and sang with the all-girl all-rock Ottowa band Sophomore Level Psychology. Her first novel, Grrrl, is currently in publishing purgatory, but she will read excerpts from it on tour anyway. Watch out, she'll be using her "teenage voice."

Atlanta GA: December 4, 2004

"Art, Beats and Lyrics"

An Art Exhibition of the Hip Hop culture

Art, Beats and Lyrics, is an urban art showcase highlighting: graffiti, abstract photography and urban paintings. A.B.L. will include DJing, Live Music from Common Ground and B-boy (Breakdancing) adding a Hip Hoppish element to an art show. The main reason for this show is to promote Hip Hop by bringing Hip Hop back in line with its roots visually, pay homage to urban artists whose work may have been passed over and to increase awareness to age group (22-35) about art appreciation at a common level, urban life and Hip Hop.

-Outlet fundraiser for art programs and clothing for others-

WHAT: Art, Beats and Lyrics

WHEN: December 4, from 8pm to until

WHERE: The 5 Spot, 1123 Euclid Ave. in Little 5 Points

TICKETS: $10 for cover/$5 along with art supplies, food or clothing donation. Tickets located at Ear Wax Records, Moods Music or at door day of event.

The show features:

Ernie Paniccioli: Legendary Hip Hop photographer has book "Who Shot ya", captured over 30 years of Hip Hop history.

Cbabi Bayoc: Acronym for Creative Black Artist Battling Ignorance and Blessed African Youth of Creativity; through his artwork, he is able to show the beauty in black faces and black life to all faces and all walks of life.

Justin Bua: Known for his urban flavored paintings; a combination of graffiti-esque style, distorted realism and urban themes made his paintings some of the most popular art among young people today

Visual Artists: Charlie Owens, Lord Yatta and Dan the Man (Vantage Pointe Studios) DL Warfield (Goldfinger Creative), Dubelyoo, Fahamu Pecou (Diamond Lounge Creative), MICHI, Darien Robbins, DANTE, Adrian Franks and Jody Harris

Apocalypse Now

polltically inspired prints

The tradition of poster art being used as a medium of protest/activism is a long and rich one. Artists/designers for decades have been using posters to voice the opinions of the masses. Issue H of Beautiful/Decay focuses on artists and designers who work in the political/activist realm voicing their opinions via their medium. To go with the release of Issue: H, B/D has teamed up with Subject Matter gallery to show the work of 14 artists in the form of Activist Poster art.

* 100% of the profits from this show will go to the Charity Food Not Bombs they are a amazing organization that actually gets things done. What they do is simple, they feed good food to homeless people all over the world. FNB is one of the only organizations that actually takes all of the money it gets and puts it direct use.

London UK: November 19 - December 16, 2004

Black Letter

An exhibition of new paintings by O.Two.

Using hooded themes and veiled motives, O.Two has created a new collection of work based around the written type-form. The new work painted for the exhibition is a snap-shot of the fractured typography and ornate interpretations of New York graffiti that have emerged from the artist's illegal pieces. Black Letter draws together the two sides of the artist's creative identity and offers a glimpse of the guilty rhythm running behind the work.

Krefeld, Germany: November 7, - December 11, 2004

OFF THE WALL 04 - Transforming Style: Graffiti weitergedacht

Arbeiten von Asket, Efas, Monika Leitner, Moritz, Maze, Neck, Retroe und Seak.

Website: http://www.offthewall04.de

Kulturfabrik Krefeld

Dießemer Str. 13

47799 Krefeld

Anfahrtsskizze: http://www.kulturfabrik-krefeld.de/programm/weg.htm

Die Ausstellung OFF THE WALL zeigt Arbeiten von acht Künstlern, die sich zum Teil seit über 15 Jahren intensiv mit dem Thema Graffiti auseinandersetzen. In dieser Zeit haben sie die deutsche und euro päische Szene geprägt, die Möglichkeiten und Spielarten des Genres ausgelotet, ihre Stile verfeinert und ihre eigenen Per spektiven gefunden. Sie alle betrachten Graffiti aus einem erwachsenen, künst lerischen Blickwinkel.

OFF THE WALL zeigt Grenzgänger: hybride Arbeiten, die Einflüsse aus Fotographie, Film, Design, Malerei und Architektur mit der wilden Typographie und dem ungebändigten Ego des Graffiti verschmelzen lassen. Hier entsteht neue Kunst, die sich den Fesseln herkömmlicher Kategorisierungen zu entziehen weiß.

Fotographie zelebriert hier inszenierte Schriftzüge als Raumkunst. Parasitäre Architektur holt die Buchstaben von der Wand und erweckt sie zu einem monumentalem Eigenleben. Die ausgestellten Raumobjekte machen Typographie greifbar, erlebbar, ja sogar begehbar. Reduzierte Grafiken verstehen es, die Schriftzüge elegant unsichtbar zu machen und die Serigrafien fangen das Kultobjekt (den Trainyard bzw. das Zugdepot) der Szene in einen traditionsreichen Kontext ein.

OFF THE WALL zeigt Kunst, die herkömmliche Sparten aufbricht und neu befruchtet. Hier verschmelzen Stilrichtungen. Hier wird Graffiti als Kunst weitergedacht.

DIE KÜNSTLER

Die acht Künstler (Asket, Efas, Monika Leitner, Moritz, Maze, Neck, Retroe, Seak/Claus Winkler) von OFF THE WALL haben die europäische Grafitti-Szene mit ihren Arbeiten beeinflusst und geprägt. Alle haben neben Auftragsarbeiten für große Unternehmen schon Einzel- und Gruppenausstellungen in Deutschland, dem europäischen Ausland und weltweit gehabt, u.a. im Museum für angewandte Kunst (Köln), Tanzhaus NRW/Global Skillz (Düsseldorf), Urban Discipline 2001 und 2002 (Hamburg), Akademie der Künste/Z 2000 - Positionen junger Kunst und Kultur (Berlin), Die Fabrik/Kunsttour 2004 (Maastricht/Niederlande), Worldspray Exhibition (Mailand/Italien), Kiasma Museum Of Contemporary Art/The Finnish National Gallery (Helsinki/ Finnland), Crewest Galerie/Abstrakte Letters (Los Angeles/USA)...

Neben zahlreichen Artikeln und Veröffentlichungen in deutschen Magazinen (z.B. Backspin, brett, PAGE) und der Tagespresse (Rheinische Post, Express etc.), wurden ihre Arbeiten auch in internationalen Maga- zinen (World Signs (FRA), Graphotism (UK), ZGB Kaos (Kroatien), Blitzkrieg (AUS)) publiziert. Ihre Arbeitsreisen führten sie neben fast allen Ländern Europas auch nach Nord- und Südamerika, Asien und Australien.

Die acht Künstler treffen in dieser Konstellation zum ersten Mal aufeinander, um ihre unterschiedlichen Perspektiven der Kunstform Graffiti einer breiten Öffentlichkeit zu präsentieren. Dabei repräsentieren sie das Konzept von OFF THE WALL - Graffiti weitergedacht auf eine individuelle und gleichzeitig vielfältige Art und Weise.

RON ENGLISH

POPagandist, billboard bandit, post-pop pundit, post-punk prankster, countercultural cartoonist, subvertising executive, culture-jammer. The artist with his finger on the pulse card of the nation. Ron English takes on the icons of pop culture and puts a little ìEnglishî on them. A Robin Hood of Madison Ave., Ron paints, perverts, infiltrates, reinvents and satirizes modern culture and its popular visual iconography on canvas, in song, and directly on his hundreds of pirated billboards. Ron exists as a pop culture anomaly, somewhere between a cartoon Abbie Hoffman and a grown-up, real life Bart Simpson, delivering a steady stream of customized imagery laden with strong socio-political undertones, adolescent boy humor, subversive pop-culture savvy, and Dali meets Disney technique. Dedicated to finding the sublime in the everyday and breaking the didactic approach to art and life, Rom has offered up an alternative universe where nothing is sacred, everything is subverted, and thereís always room for a little good-natured fun.

Tentoonstelling 14.11--19.12- 2004 met werken op papier en schilderijen van Lin Felton.

ZONDAG 14 NOVEMBER VINDT OP HEIKANT 20 OM 14u DE OPNENING PLAATS VAN NIEUWE WERKEN VAN LIN FELTON (QUIK) DOOR DE CURATOR VAN HET GRONINGER MUSEUM STEVEN KOLSTEREN.

OM 14.30u. VINDT DE UITREIKING PLAATS VAN HET BOEK MET WERKEN VAN AARON VAN ERP. DE UITREIKING VINDT PLAATS DOOR DE KUNSTKRITIKUS ROB SMOLDERS.

LIN FELTON schrijft mij n.a.v. zijn nieuwste schilderijen, waarvan ik u als bijlage een werk toestuur, het volgende: “ These newest works once again reflect the unbridled freedom I maintain here in Holland as an artist. The culturally diverse and radically progressive nature of the Eurpean art community has once again fostered and laid a new platformlike foundation for my recent expressions. No longer am I trapped, confined nor manacled by the chains bound to the New York graffiti culture. I create a furious calamity when I paint, yet this fury is my voice……my freedom”.

Lin Felton is een begenadigd kunstenaar die in staat is zijn innerlijke gevoelens, gedragen door zijn geschiedenis, in een veelheid aan expressies tot uiting te brengen. Felton beschikt over humor, zelfspot, intense verlangens en noodzakelijkheid om vorm te geven aan een door het leven van de zwarte cultuur in de Verenigde Staten gevormde ziel. Felton’s tekeningen zijn aantekeningen van zijn ziel en meestal komen snel tot stand. Collectioneurs die schilderijen van Felton verzamelen raad ik ook altijd aan zijn tekeningen te verzamelen. Deze tekeningen zijn voorafspiegelingen van wat in zijn meer gedragen schilderijen tot uiting komt. Felton schildert en tekent over grote verlangens, liefde, leven en dood, lijden, onrecht en maatschappijkritiek als de eeuwig terugkerende motieven zoals we die bij alle grote kunstenaars aantreffen.

Behalve Schoots galerie is nu ook een top galerie in Duitsland in het werk van Felton geïnteresseerd. Hierover zal ik u op de hoogte blijven houden.

Graag verneem ik van u i.v.m. de te verwachten grote opkomst of u aanwezig kunt zijn.

PARTS AND LABOR

from NY – new works by: AJ Fosik * Monster Project * kgbe RotGut

Artists' Reception: First Frday November 5th, 8 p.m. 'til late

Music by: DJ Aidan

Admission: free

AJ Fosik is originally from Detroit, now hailing from Brooklyn. He combines images and iconography carefully collected and scavenged from past traditions both real and fabricated which are interpreted and woven together to create a trenchant body of work that is equal parts signage, folly and hard luck story.

Monster Project looks to give a face to the cannibalism of urban life, a face to that which is always eating itself, a face to that which is our Cities. Monster Project seeks to highlight the unnoticed, to find the forgotten. Monster Project is about pointing out what is already here around us with the hope that it may encourage the act of looking around. Monster Project looks to inspire the act of taking a moment to stop and to see again. Monster Project is about noticing the beauty that naturally happens in these places we call City.

Over the past four years, the Monster Project team has created site-specific installations focusing on forgotten corners. Often requiring extensive planning and late night execution, each piece becomes a story, each installation and adventure. No two are exactly the same, as no two locations are ever identical. Conceived in Providence, Rhode Island in November of 2000, Monsters have feasted on Providence, Boston, New York and Rome, Italy.

kgbe Rotgut has become a prominent figure in the illegal street art movement in NY over the past couple of years. Much like his work on the street, the pieces in this show are inspired by and use materials found in the blighted urban areas of North American cities. His newest series of paintings and sculptures blend the convoluted complexity of 19th century maps of America with the raw beauty of rusted metal and chipped paint. Obscure vestiges of our nation’s sordid past are constructed in new ways to form a unique visual experience.

Call for participation

HUB of activity at:

Project Row Houses

show / deadline November 13-14, 2004

Public space is ours, the people who live, work, and play in it; and accordingly we should reclaim it with our culture, with our creativity, and with autonomy. It has become common to see wheatpaste, graffiti, and protest banners, but also there is a variety of other projects which have taken over the urban enviroment.

The Dumpster Hub will remind people of street artists' props as well as serve as walls for presentation. We will set up a convergence in Houston for 48 hours of non-stop occupation, intervention, recreation, and re-invention of public space away from the Project Row Houses Campus. We hope to provide a center of operations, establish a hub from which projects will radiate out across Houston.

The emphasis of this campaign is on the creative usage and appropriation of public space by autonomous individuals and groups from all walks of life. As such we welcome submissions from artists and non-artists alike

Participants will present their documentation of their projects on Tri-fold boards (like the ones from Science Fair) and possibly disseminate propaganda or art to other participants. This is to encourage and support a community of public space reclaimers and the projects that exist there,

A schedule of events will be presented including specified discussions on public space, skillshares, and demonstrations of techniques. We hope to set up documentation crews, propaganda crews, art crews, to roam the city and bring back their energy. We are hoping participants will bring these guidelines into the Hub (proposals should have one or more of these points in mind):

1) The project is specifically geared towards reclaiming space in the Houston Area (we will try to assist, but participants must work out the details of their spatial reclamations). Site-specificity (e.g. - the Metro Rail at Main and Alabama) and site-generality (e.g. - public transportation) are equally acceptable but should be stated to help us better organize.

2) The project provides free materials from "Hub" to visitors/participants for distribution, installation, and/or operation in public space (i.e. - stickers, 'zines, posters, smoke bombs, stencils, condoms, how-to manuals, noise-makers, first-aid kits, handcuff keys, kites, etc, etc, etc).

3) The project is interactive, collaborative, and/or relational with other individuals, groups, participants or visitors (i.e. - workshops, teach-ins, cooking, legal services, scavenger hunts, bike rides, protests, blood drives, etc, etc, etc). These types of projects may take place at the "Hub", or may use the headquarters as a meeting place/laboratory.

4) All projects will be video-documented or photographed and screened on monitors at the "Hub". A corresponding city map will allow visitors to reference the project and its location in the urban environment.

5) Although the campaign will be occurring around-the-clock, individual projects are not bound to any spatial or temporal restrictions.

Deadline is the opening: It will be November 13-14 at Project Row Houses in Houston's 3rd Ward.

Los Angeles, CA: October 23 - November 27, 2004

Lost In _ _ _ _ _

Opening October 23rd. 6-9pm

4-F is pleased to present Lost In _ _ _ _ _, a show that gathers the work of two Los Angeles based painters, Christofer Chin (Tofer) and Amir H. Fallah.

Although disparate in their painting techniques each artists’ work demonstrates fantastic environments, which act as a background for elusive activities and narratives filling the foregrounds of the work.

In some of the large and small-scale paintings by Christofer Chin (Tofer) random limbs and faceless, figures seem to disappear and re-surface while eerily moving through murky fog filled landscapes. These scenarios allude to dream states where somnambulists roam undisturbed through anonymous locations. In this body of work Chin is exploring how dreams are utilized as a way to grasp onto the fragments of childhood memories often repressed in the process of maturation.

Amir H. Fallah presents multiple large and small scale paintings where flat, graphic passages are mixed with faux, expressionist swatches of paint; Morrissey lyrics are side by side with detailed patterning; and love notes to female painters, professing his love for their work, are clumsily stacked on top of one another. Fallah’s paintings deal with a more personalized and humorous approach to the often regressive and progressive commute between adolescence and adulthood.

Berlin Germany: October 28 - 30, 2004

Pictoplasma Conference on contemporary character design

Lectures, panel discussions and workshops will provide in-depth examination of the global movement of contemporary character design. More than 20 style-setting yet stylistically diverse artists and designers such as the Australian design Collective Rinzen, the American illustrator Gary Baseman or Japanese Character developers Furi Furi will talk about the meaning of characters in their work, provide insights into their production methods and engage in open discussion rounds.

The accompanying design exhibition “Characters at war!” will enable visitors to meet the elite of international character design literally eye-to-eye. From Super Mario to Dalek’s Space Monkeys: Hundreds of all time favorites and shiny newcomers from the flat-faced world of comics, graffiti and merchandising are pushing through to the third dimension! The loveliest, cutest, and strangest characters stand tall as life-size cardboard stand-up soldiers arranged in a gigantic walkthrough battlefield installation! A classical war painting comes to life in a cut-throat competition of consumer icons and brutally violated copyrights!

And behind the foot soldiers of this enormous anthropomorphic army are none other than the heroes of the international design scene: Buero Destruct, Phunk Studio, Snowcat, Fawn Gehweiler, Furi Furi, Francois Chalet, ESM, ACNE, James Marschall, ShagArt, Mari-chan, unit9, Jim Avignon and many, many more...

With an extensive accompanying program of exhibitions, performances, film screenings, parties and VJ sessions, the pictoplasma conference offers you an inspirational overview of the very latest trends in character design and an ideal opportunity to explore the best of Berlin.

London UK: October 25 - 29, 2004

Through the Looking Glass

Live graffiti installation comes to Seven Dials

'Through the Looking Glass' a major installation by World renowned graffiti artists Remi/Rough, Stormie, System and TiMiD will launch in 'London's most fashionable shopping area', Seven Dials, on 25th October. Running until 29th October the installation will allow visitors a rare, first hand insight into the four artist's collaborative work, from the moment they unpack their rucksacks and Powerbooks through to completion of the finished work…. all in just one day.

Using spray paint, photography, sculpture and illustration the interior of the Thomas Neals Centre will be transformed into a live installation, which once completed will be on show to members of the public until Friday 29th October.

The Artists:

Remi/Rough

Rough is one of the most respected and sought after UK artists around today, having put 18 years into developing his now classic, trademark style and the UK scene. He has worked for clients such as Red Bull, Kangol and Nike and exhibited in the UK, Australia, Germany, Belgium, France and the United States to critical acclaim. Rough is also an accomplished graphic designer utilising his graffiti style within his graphic work.

Stormie

Stormie Mills is a visual artist with an extensive experience in the area of large scale public artworks. Over the last 15 years he has worked throughout Western Australia and in both the United States and Europe. His works are primarily focused upon the interpretation of peoples' emotional status detailed in mono-chromatic palettes and coupled with the textural examination of exterior surface.

System

It's the usual story - young, listening to Hip Hop, breakdancing and reading comics. After seeing 'Style Wars' and being convinced by Stormboy to go 'painting', he never looked back. In 1989 he hooked up with a bunch of like-minded individuals and formed the Ikonoklast Movement, the most unique crew in the UK, who influence and piss off people in equal measure. System's work has been seen on walls, T-shirts, and record covers as well as in fonts, logo designs and computer games.

TiMiD

Timid is one of the most innovative photographers in London, having sold his wares to countless trendy and underground magazines, not to mention his prized collection of photographs of New York forward thinkers forward-thinking Anti Pop Consortium. He has also had countless exhibitions and put the 'Rigidmouth' book together with his long time friend and collaborator Rough. He describes his style of photography as accidentally abstract and can be found near tall buildings with an ancient Konica admiring the view.

CASAnova präsentiert: Wri(o)te!

Das Einbrechen einer Subversion der Zeichen in die geordnete Geometrie des städtischen Raums - Omnipräsenz einer mal ernsten, mal ironischen Gegenwartskunst der Strasse jenseits von Eigentumstiteln und musealem Charakter.

Der Abend öffnet einen filmischen Einblick in die culture interdit der Graffitiszene. Während der Nacht verwandeln sich Kölner Strassen in ein grosses Atelier in dem der städtische Raum immer und immer wieder neu kartographiert wird um während des Tages in eine umstrittene Galerie zu transformieren. Farbrebellen ist die Preview-Version einer demnächst auf ARTE laufenden Dokumentation über die Umtriebe der Kölner Graffitiszene und ihrer Gegner. Die zentrale Frage des Films ist dabei: Wem gehört die Stadt?

Mit Orbitanor und Samedi&Shango sind zwei kurze Animationsfilme des Kölner Filmemachers und Graffitikünstlers Christoph Dunkel am Start. Der Videokünstler Hannes Aurand präsentiert eine Kollage Kölner Tags und führt damit in die nahezu kalligraphische Ästhetik des Taggen ein.

MASH-UP is an inspired collection of new work from emerging artists working to challenge the techniques and forms of traditional mediums. In a hostile world that demands constant evolution, these artists offer a bold new perspective on creating and interacting with visual statements by calling into question the constraints that dictate the art world. Through a wide collection of work drawing from multiple mediums, one begins to see more commonalities than differences; suddenly, a video composite becomes a moving painting, aerosol artists become this generation's historians.

VESSEL Gallery is a fresh urban gallery and retail space seeking to inspire and progress the work of creatively ambitious, emerging talent. Located in the heart of industrial Brooklyn, the gallery is a malleable receptacle for the artistic visions of a new generation unafraid of exploding the boundaries of high and low, old and new. A collaborative endeavor with Mathmatiks Lifestyle and Design, the space radically redefines the retail experience by exploring the multiplicity of artistic mediums within an urban consumer outlet.

Pornograffiti

Terratag Presents:

PORNOGRAFFITI - The Joy of Text.

Terratag takes the spirit of Japan and fucks it up, twisting Japanese themes into a unique graphic vocabulary. Mutating and originating a truly innovative Anglo-Japanese hybrid.

Until now, graffiti art has been Hip-Hop based, only using the western alphabet. I have turned my back on both, adding a new dialect to the genre of contemporary graffik art.

Primarily a showcase of typographic experimentation, fun and mayhem, Pornograffiti is an inspired mix of Porno, Wild Style Graffiti, Tagging, Manga, Samurai B-Boys and Tattooed Japanese B-Girls.

Pornograffiti will run from September 6th to October 31st at the Notting Hill Arts Club.

Munich Germany: August 20 - October 31, 2004

lothringer dreizehn cordially invites you to the exhibition

spacemakers

organized in collaboration with Brett Bloom, Temporary Services, Chicago

Opening: Friday, August 20, 7:00 - 9:00 p.m.

Exhibition dates: August 21 - October 31, 2004

Basekamp (Philadelphia); Casco Projects (Utrecht); Espacio La Culpable (Lima); God Bless Graffiti Coalition, Inc. (Chicago); P.A.R.A.S.I.T.E. Museum of Contemporary Art (Ljubljana); project MOBILIVRE-BOOKMOBILE project (Philadelphia); <rotor> (Graz); Sparwasser HQ (Berlin); sub11 (München); Swinger (Munich); Institute for Transacoustic Research (Vienna); Transmission (Glasgow); The Suburban (Chicago); Transformers (Munich/Berlin); YNKB (Copenhagen)

spacemakers is about wedging one's ideas and programs into places or spaces one doesn't have, working creatively around a set of preexisting conditions, and turning limitations into advantages. There are countless project rooms, artist groups, and collectives who are implementing influential projects and programs outside institutional frameworks and with little money or physical space. The exhibition focuses on this globally expanding "do-it-yourself" ethos by presenting an international cross-section of methods and strategies.

During the exhibition, a collection of documentary footage on and about other spacemakers will be presented in the video room located in our basement. The diverse collection of material is divided into three categories, "Making Space," "Invading Space," and "Media Space," and demonstrates further strategies for creating free space. The program was researched and curated especially for the spacemakers exhibition by Brett Bloom, Temporary Services, and Chicago-based independent scholar, Ava Bromberg. Installations by God Bless Graffiti Coalition, Rok2, and Sat1.

San Francisco CA: July 2004 - ?

Between Art and Life: The Contemporary Painting and Sculpture Collection

Ongoing Exhibition with Twist

In 1961 Robert Rauschenberg said, "Painting relates to both art and life. Neither can be made. (I try to act in that gap between the two.)"

This new presentation of the SFMOMA collection is organized around this philosophy. With works from the past five decades, the exhibition emphasizes special concentrations within SFMOMA's holdings and celebrates the achievements of individual artists with several large-scale installations and multiple-work presentations, many of which the Museum has never shown. Featured artists include Louise Bourgeois, Robert Gober, Eva Hesse, Anish Kapoor, Sherrie Levine, Brice Marden, Gordon Matta-Clark, Barry McGee, Bruce Nauman, Robert Rauschenberg, and Kara Walker.

San Francisco CA: July 16 - October 3, 2004

Beautiful Losers

/ Raymond Pettibon / Larry Clark / Jean-Michel Basquiat / Thomas Campbell / Brian Donnelly [KAWS] / Cynthia Connolly / Cheryl Dunn / Todd James [REAS] / Jo Jackson / Shepard Fairey / Ed Templeton / Barry McGee / Ryan McGinley / Tobin Yelland / Pushead / Phil Frost / Neil Blender / Ryan McGinness / Craig R. Stecyk / Stephen Powers [ESPO] / Ari Marcopoulos / Mike Mills / R. Crumb / Geoff McFetridge / Henry Chalfant / Spike Jonze / Glen E. Friedman / Clare E. Rojas / Andy Warhol / Futura / Andy Jenkins / Margaret Kilgallen / Wes Humpston / Rostarr / Keith Haring / Terry Richardson / Harmony Korine / Evan Hecox / Mark Gonzales / James Jarvis / Chris Johanson

Beautiful Losers is an exhibition of art and design that explores 30 years worth of work by a diverse group of visual artists that have emerged from aspects of the street culture loosely organized around the subcultures of skateboarding, graffiti, punk, and hip-hop. The exhibit includes painting, sculpture, and photography, as well as film, video, and product design by these individuals, among others.

To complement this material, the exhibition will also offer an environmental soundscape that traces the relationship between these subcultures and various genres of popular music, compiled by former professional skateboarder and musician Tommy Guerrero; a selection of ephemeral materials (album covers, skateboard decks, toys, zines, etc.) produced in or related to this milieu; and a film and video program to be screened within the exhibition itself.

The exhibition is being organized in collaboration with its founders Christian Strike and Aaron Rose of Iconoclast; the Contemporary Arts Center, Cincinnati; and the Yerba Buena Center for the Arts, San Francisco . The San Francisco Opening isJuly 16-17, 2004 . A fully illustrated 272-page book published by Iconoclast and distributed by D.A.P. will be available.
